author: 13abc
title: Toledo mayoral candidates face off in debate
text:
TOLEDO (13abc Action News) - With less than two weeks until Election Day, the Toledo mayoral candidates took part in another televised debate. NBC 24 and 1370 WSPD held this debate.
They gave each candidate the chance to explain why they're the best fit for the seat for Toledo Mayor. One of those questions was about what each would do about of gang violence, that hasn't been done before.
Sandy Drabik Collins says, "I do believe that we do not have enough police officers, and part of my platform is to increase the amount of police officers."
Paula Hicks-Hudson suggests "that we all have to give an alternative. That could be either education opportunities or employment opportunities."
Opal Covey says "there will be less crime when we get more businesses in the city."
Sandy Spang thinks "it's time our youth commission within the city. I think it needs to be a more active department."
Carty Finkbeiner says that we need to "let the police be policemen; focus upon gang leaders."
However, Mike Bell says that "you cannot police your way out of this situation."
Mike Ferner claims that "policing, of course, is important. But we have to address the root causes of why people join gangs."
You can watch our debate next Wednesday, October 28th at 7:00 P.M. right here on 13abc
